programme.title: Wimbledon 2016 - Live
programme.desc: Coverage from the All England Club, as day four of the third Grand Slam tournament of the year gets under way, featuring the men's and ladies' second-round matches. While most of the seeded players enjoyed comfortable passages to round three on this day last year, former champion Rafael Nadal continued his poor recent run in the tournament, having failed to make it past round four since 2011. The Spaniard lost in four sets to qualifier Dustin Brown and is missing this time as his troublesome wrist continues to hamper his chances of attaining full fitness. Roger Federer played on Centre Court in the match preceding Nadal's last year, and strolled to a 6-4, 6-2, 6-2 victory against Sam Querrey, and Petra Kvitova continued the defence of her title with a straightforward win over Kurumi Nara.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2016 - Live
programme.desc: Coverage from the All England Club, where the third Grand Slam tournament of the year has reached the third-round stage in the men's and ladies' singles draws. Novak Djokovic and Stan Wawrinka both eased through to the last 16 with straight-sets victories on this day last year, against Bernard Tomic and Fernando Verdasco respectively. However, there were a couple of notable upsets in the men's draw, as Richard Gasquet defeated Grigor Dimitrov in the opening match on Centre Court, and the controversial Nick Kyrgios eliminated Milos Raonic in four sets on Court Two.(n)
